sentences.en: Eighteen shillings a month, together with diet and pillage.
sentences.cn: 月饷十八先令, 加上伙食和战利品.

sentences.en: If we pull legions from the west, the Goths will pillage us instead.
sentences.cn: 如果我们把西线的军团调到这里,抢劫我们的将换成高斯人.

sentences.en: Soldiers went on a rampage, pillaging stores and shooting.
sentences.cn: 士兵狂暴地掠夺商店，不停地扫射。

sentences.en: The AI will no longer pillage Barbarian Cities.
sentences.cn: AI不会去摧毁野人城市了.

sentences.en: The sense of wrongs, the injustices, the oppression, extortion, and pillage of twenty years suddenly and found voice in a raucous howl of execration.
sentences.cn: 二十年来所深受的损害、压迫、勒索、掠夺和不公平的对待，一下子达到了最高峰，在一阵粗声粗气的谩骂叫嚣里发泄出来。

sentences.en: The transfer of power in 1947 was accompanied by slaughter and pillage of huge proportions.
sentences.cn: 1947年的权力转移是伴随着屠杀大面积掠夺而来.

sentences.en: There were no signs of violence or pillage.
sentences.cn: 没有暴力和掠夺的迹象。

sentences.en: To enter by force in order to conquer or pillage.
sentences.cn: 侵略以武力进入以便征服或掠夺.

sentences.en: Tribute formerly paid to freebooters along the scottish border for protection from pillage.
sentences.cn: 勒索贡物从前为防止海盗抢劫,沿苏格兰边境向海盗上贡之物.

words.tran_cn: 药丸；弹丸，子弹；口服避孕药
把…制成丸剂；使服用药丸；抢劫，掠夺（古语）

trans.tran_en: if soldiers pillage a place in a war, they steal a lot of things and do a lot of damage
